details.name: Borbam Balichapari - Kalyanpur Road
details.remarks:
The road shoulder has been severely damaged at Ch. 2.200 km. A large nallah flows adjacent to the right-hand side (RHS) of the road between Ch. 2.100 km and Ch. 2.200 km. Due to rain extensive erosion along this stretch, undermining the stability of the road embankment.
Date 03/10/2025

details.name: Rokhapara to Rangsapara Road
details.remarks: As per report submitted by the Executive Engineer, PWRD, Goalpara west and Dudhnoi TR Division, Lakhipur Goalpara, The road has been damaged between chainage 250.00 M and 290.00 M due to continuous seepage from the existing pond adjacent to the left side berm and the incessant rainfall over the past several days from 30.09.2025 to 5.10.2025 has further aggravated the deterioration of the hard crust and side berm in this stretch.

details.name: GAR-ALI ROAD AT 40 TH KM
details.remarks: Affected due to flash flood of river senijan on 01.10.2025

details.name: Bonai Missing Gaon (Fanijan Arunamukh Connecting Road)
details.remarks: Due to breach of the Left Ring Bund of Jhanji, flood water entered the area, resulting in severe flooding consequently, the road leading to Arunamukh Tini Ali has been badly damaged, with significant erosion of the road shoulders.

details.name: Dhekorgorah Road
details.remarks: Due to rise in water level of Bhogdoi River, boiling occured at various location, Also the flood waters overflowed the road and to address Road these issues stacking of sand filled cement bags was done at various locations where the problem occurred

details.name: Bormer choladhora Bundh
details.remarks: Due to the rise in the water level of the Bhogdoi River, water has started overflowing from the ring bund near Bormer Choladhora village (Solmora). As a result, the low-lying areas of Bormer Choladhora Pathar and Gergeri Pathar under Jorhat West Revenue Circle have been inundated.

remarks.remarks: (Udharbond - Due to heavy rainfall on the 12/10/2025, a flash flood occurred in Majhargram Grant Revenue Village under Udharbond Revenue Circle, affecting 140 households. A total of 140 Nos.food kits were distributed to the affected families on 13.10.2025)
(Teok - Total Chlorine Tablet Distributed 305 Nos. by PHE Department.), (Jorhat West - as per the report received from agriculture dept.19 hectares of crop area have been submerged.)
